column1: Title: Women Age 40 and Older Who Report Having Had a Mammogram Within the Past Two Years by Race/Ethnicity | KFF
Data represent women age 40 and older who report having had a mammogram within the last two years.

In 2009, the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force updated its recommendation on mammography screening to recommend biennial mammograms for women aged 50 to 74 years.  The prior recommendation of the USPSTF issued in 2002 recommended mammography with or without clinical breast examination (CBE), every 1-2 years for women aged 40 and older. Under the Affordable Care Act, the standard for coverage of mammography screenings by private plans is the 2002 recommendation.

Data based on the Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System (BRFSS), an ongoing, state-based, random-digit-dialed telephone survey of non-institutionalized civilian adults aged 18 years and older. For more information about BRFSS, go to [http://www.cdc.gov/brfss/index.html](http://www.cdc.gov/brfss/index.html).
Kaiser Family Foundation analysis of the Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)'s Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System (BRFSS) 2020 Survey Results.
1. US totals exclude data from the territories.
